actions.in_committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. H. Rept. 102-350, Part I.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 209.
Discharged from Union Calendar.

Referred sequentially to the House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs for a period ending not later than Nov. 25, 1991 for consideration of such provisions of the bill and amendment as fall within the jurisdiction of that committee pursuant to clause 1(l) of rule X.
Mr. Jones (NC) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed until Nov. 25.

Mr. Gunderson asked unanimous consent to vacate the order of November 23, 1991, ordering a vote on the motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill. Agreed to without objection. The Chair announced that the question would be put on the motion later in the day.
Considered as unfinished business.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 733.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
By Senator Johnston from Committee on Energy and Natural Resources filed written report. Report No. 102-467.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 102-489.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Fisheries and Wildlife Conservation and the Environment
Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

official_title: Making technical amendments to the law which authorizes modification of the boundaries of the Alaska Maritime National Wildlife Refuge.

summary.text: Koniag Lands Conveyance Amendments of 1991 - Amends Federal law to make technical amendments relating to an exchange between the Secretary of the Interior and Koniag incorporated in Alaska of certain surface and subsurface estates to be included in the Alaska Maritime National Wildlife Refuge.

titles.title: Making technical amendments to the law which authorizes modification of the boundaries of the Alaska Maritime National Wildlife Refuge.
